title: What is JVM and how does it work?

answers.junior: The JVM (Java Virtual Machine) is a virtual machine that runs Java bytecode. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. It converts bytecode into machine code that the computer can understand.
answers.middle: The JVM is an abstract computing machine that provides a runtime environment for Java applications. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. It includes class loader, bytecode verifier, and execution engine with JIT compilation.
answers.senior: The JVM is a specification-based implementation providing memory management, garbage collection, and execution optimization. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. It features multiple GC algorithms, stack-based architecture, and runtime optimizations through C1/C2 compilers.
answers.tricky: Consider JVM warmup, tiered compilation, escape analysis, and intrinsics. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Discuss class data sharing, AppCDS, AOT compilation, and JVM tuning parameters like -XX flags.
